channel.title: Classic 508 Run.Bat Error
channel.description:
This is my run.bat file.
[code]@echo off title Starting... echo. echo Starting StandardScape{508} echo. cd ../bin title StandardScape "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\java.exe" palidino76/rs2/Server 43594 pause[/code]
Get this error. http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/228/errorys.png/ It has different titles(Don't worry about that)
My jdk version is 6.0_24. My Environmental variables are set.
Here's where I have server.class located http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/543/error2q.png/
I'm not too bad with coding, rsps, et cetera. But it seems no one has a solution for this. I have it in the correct directory(I believe) and I have the correct jdk settings. What do I do?
By the way, I do have permission to use this as a base, and/or source.
Just PM me, or post it here, so others with this error may find some guidance.

item.title: Classic 508 Run.Bat Error
item.dc:creator: @kbdraco kbdraco
item.description:
@kbdraco wrote:

Found the solution

This is what my environmental variable (CLASSPATH I think) was set to. For anyone who has a relative problem
just do this

Simple semi-colon should fix it. Or at least it did for me.

I couldn’t find this ANYWHERE on the net, i just hypothesized it working.–Note this might not work for you.

Read full topic

@davidi2 wrote:

Interesting, it looks like it’s in the right place to me.

Did you rename any of the files or packages? Have you ever compiled the source?

@kbdraco wrote:

http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/84/error3f.png/

Green is the folder they’re in.
Blue is the folder that ~palidino76/rs2/server are in
Red is where Run.bat is located.

If this isn’t what you meant, just tell me.

item.title: Classic 508 Run.Bat Error
item.dc:creator: @kbdraco kbdraco
item.description:
@kbdraco wrote:

This is my run.bat file.

@echo off title Starting... echo. echo Starting StandardScape{508} echo. cd ../bin title StandardScape "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\java.exe" palidino76/rs2/Server 43594 pause

Get this error.
http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/228/errorys.png/
It has different titles(Don’t worry about that)

My jdk version is 6.0_24.
My Environmental variables are set.

Here’s where I have server.class located
http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/543/error2q.png/

I’m not too bad with coding, rsps, et cetera. But it seems no one has a solution for this.
I have it in the correct directory(I believe) and I have the correct jdk settings. What do I do?

By the way, I do have permission to use this as a base, and/or source.

Just PM me, or post it here, so others with this error may find some guidance.

Read full topic
